name: 10 Difficult Questions about USA Sports Mixed

questions.text: Which city was Super Bowl XLII played in early 2008?
questions.explanation:
Phoenix.

	The big game was between Eli Manning and his New York Giants against the perfect season New England Patriots.  The Giants and Plaxico Burress spoiled the Patriots' hopes by hauling in the winning touchdown with 35 seconds to go in the game.

questions.text: What is not a normal part of a recreational inline skate?
questions.explanation:
Toe Brake.

	Unlike ice and quad skates, inline skates use a heel brake to stop.

questions.text: How many regular season wins did the Philadelphia Phillies have in 2008?
questions.explanation:
92.

	For the second consecutive season, the Phils clinched the NL East on the final weekend of the season.  They finished 3 games ahead of the second place Mets and had the second best record in the National League, behind the Cubs.

questions.text: In Game 5 of the 2006 NBA Finals, who accidentally called timeout after Dwyane Wade's second free throw in the final seconds of the game, costing the Mavericks the game and eventually the series?
questions.explanation:
Josh Howard.

	Coach Johnson had his hands in timeout formation but he wanted it after the second free throw Dwyane Wade shot.  It was Dallas' last timeout and they were down 105-104.  If they would have had the timeout, they would have got to take it out at half court, but they had to take it the full length of the court to try and win.

questions.text: Which team won the Stanley Cup in the 1960-61 season?
questions.explanation:
Chicago Black Hawks.

	The Black Hawks defeated the Detroit Red Wings four games to two.  This included the game six clincher of 5-1 to win their third Stanley Cup.

questions.text: Baseball's Frank Viola pitched the only one-hitter of his career with which team?
questions.explanation:
Red Sox.

	He threw it 1992.  Frank threw eight of his 15 seasons with the Twins, but his one-hitter was with the Red Sox.

questions.text: In amateur wrestling, how many points is an escape worth?
questions.explanation:
1.

	When your opponent has taken you down to the mat and is in full control of you, then you stand up and out of his reach, it is called an escape  You get one point for this.

questions.text: Dwyane Wade was originally drafted by which NBA team in 2003?
questions.explanation:
Miami Heat.

	Wade was the fifth overall pick behind LeBron James, Darko Milicic, Carmelo Anthony, and Chris Bosh.  Wade was drafted out of Marquette University.

questions.text: Which starting pitcher on the 2008 Phillies had the most wins?
questions.explanation:
Jamie Moyer.

	At age 45, Jamie Moyer led the Phillies with wins, going 16-7.  Although Hamels was one of the most dominating pitchers in the season, he only had 14 wins.  Kendrick was 11-9 and Myers went 10-13.

questions.text: Who set a Major League Baseball record for hitting 18 World Series home runs in his career?
questions.explanation:
Mickey Mantle.

	Mantle played his entire Yankee career from 1951-1968.  He played in 12 World Series with the Yankees and went home with seven titles.  Mickey hit three home runs in a World Series, three times in his career.
